doubles ... named first team All-WAC in singles and doubles ... awarded WAC Player of the Week three times in the spring ... competed at No. 1 singles and doubles as a freshman ... posted a 18-6 singles record in the spring season ... reached No. 42 in ITA rankings, the highest on the team ... contributed to the 'Dogs advancement in the ITA team rankings to No. 59 ... played in the NCAA Tournament against No. 20 Notre Dame and earned the first set victory over No. 5 Kristy Frilling but could not finish because the match was clinched ... clinched the match against No. 51 Arizona defeating Lacey Smyth, 1-6, 6-3, 6-4 ... went undefeated in WAC play in singles and doubles ... was victorious over UNLV's No. 68 Lucia Batta, 6-2, 0-6, 6-2... defeated No. 74 Stephanie Hoffpauir from USD, 6-4, 6-4... defeated her third ranked opponent, No. 18 Mari Anderson from No. 10 California, 5-7, 6-3, 1-0(8) ... posted a 12-13 doubles record in dual season .... defeated the No. 34 doubles team from Pepperdine, 8-2 with partner Laura Pola ... advanced to the Round of 32 in singles in the ITA Northwest Regional to finish off the fall season., 12620=2013-14: Compiled an overall record of 26-9 in the spring season, including a 17-4 ledger in dual matches … posted an 8-2 record in ACC play … reached 100-win mark against Komal Safdar (6-1, 6-4) of Syracuse on Feb. 23 … beat Alex Moreno-Kaste, 6-2, 6-1, to reach the quarterfinals of the Duke Fab Four Invitational … reached final round of SDSU Fall Tennis Classic after defeating Susana Alcaraz, 6-4, 6-1, in the quarterfinals then Apichaya Runglerdkriangkrai, 6-4, 6-0, in the semifinals … defeated opponent Tiana Takenaga, 6-0, 6-0, to clinch the Blue Devils win over Columbia on Jan. 24 … outlasted Xue Zhang, 6-1, 6-2, of No. 46 Wake Forest, leading the Blue Devils to a victory … defeated No. 31 Maegen Manasse, 1-6, 6-3, 11-9, to clinch the final team point against No. 8 California on Feb. 9, sending the Blue Devils to the finals at the ITA National Team Indoor Championship … maintained a season-high nine-match win streak from Feb. 23 through Apr. 11 … teamed with three different partners in doubles play throughout the season, compiling a 21-5 overall record, finishing 12-2 in dual matches and 6-1 in the ACC … reached doubles semifinals of Duke Fab Four Invitational … claimed the red doubles bracket title at the SDSU Classic alongside Alyssa Smith, after the duo defeated Kristin Buth and Laura Antonana Iriarte of San Diego State 8-7 (3)., 2752=2012-13, 11220=2012-13: Led team in first full season as a Blue Devil with 30-8 overall record, including an 18-2 ledger in dual matches … compiled a perfect 5-0 mark in ACC play … ranked No. 112 by ITA and reached a personal best No. 27 during the year … outlasted DePaul’s No. 73 Jasmine Kling 6-4, 4-6, 6-2, at ITA Riviera All-American tournament … defeated Olivia Janowicz 2-6, 6-4, 6-2, to clinch the final team point against No. 2 Florida on Feb. 17 … beat No. 75 Anna Depenau 7-5, 7-6, to reach round of 16 in ITA Riviera All-American tournament … knocked out No. 71 Caroline Price 6-1, 5-7, 1-0 (10-6), in Duke Fab Four Invitational … routed Ellie Ball 6-1, 6-0, to win White Draw of Kitty Harrison Invitational on Nov. 12 … reached quarterfinal of ITA Riviera All-American tournament … clinched winning team point by beating Ole Miss’s No. 125 Mai El Kamash 6-3, 6-1, on May 11, advancing the team to the second round of the NCAA Tournament … overcame Texas Tech’s Elizabeth Ullathorne 6-7 (4-6), 6-2, 6-3, to clinch team victory on May 12 … posted a 21-8 overall doubles record, including a 4-3 ACC mark … teamed with Annie Mulholland to record a 14-3 ledger in the No. 2 spot … ranked No. 27  in doubles with Mary Clayton … earned seven consecutive midseason-wins alongside Annie Mulholland … reached doubles semifinals of Duke Fab Four Invitational. 2011-12 (Fresno State): Competed in all 21 dual matches... named the WAC Player of the Year for a second consecutive year ... honored in the WAC All-Tournament team in singles and doubles ... named first team All-WAC in singles... awarded WAC Player of the Week six times in the season and WAC Player of the Month in October... competed at No. 1 singles and doubles ... posted a 19-5 record on the season and 30-9 overall in singles... reached No. 39 in ITA rankings, a personal high... earned an automatic berth to the NCAA Singles Championships... advanced to the Round of 32 in singles in the ITA Northwest Regional to finish off the fall season ... the only member of the team to compete in the NCAA Singles Championships... earned a perfect 6-0 record against WAC opponents ... went 3-4 against ranked opponents ... bested No. 7 Miami's No. 18 Anna Bartenstein, 4-6, 5-3, 10-7... topped Hawaii's Barbara Pinterova, 6-2, 6-3, in the WAC Championships... posted an 18-11 overall record and 13-7 dual record in doubles ...earned second team All-WAC in doubles with partner Laura Pola ... fell to Washington's 17th-ranked Denise Dy, 6-4, 7-6 (3) in the first round of the NCAA Singles Championships., 1893=2013-14, 4474=2010-11, 6971=Personal: Born Jan. 12, 1993 ... parents are Josee Gaudreault and Luc Jodoin ... has one brother, Vincent ... favorite athlete is Roger Federer because he brought tennis to another level ... admires her parents.}
textBeforeTable: Personal: Born Jan. 12, 1993 ... parents are Josee Gaudreault and Luc Jodoin ... has one brother, Vincent ... favorite athlete is Roger Federer because he brought tennis to another level ... admires her parents. Prior to College: Won ITF doubles grade A in Casablanca, Mexico ... competed in second round of singles and doubles of the Australian Open ... won the Prince Cup grade 4 in Florida ... had a personal best ITF Junior Ranking of 72 ... Finalist in the Canadian Nation Championship. 2010-11 (Fresno State): Named the WAC Player of the Year and Freshman of the Year ... honored in the WAC All-Tournament team in singles and doubles ... named first team All-WAC in singles and doubles ... awarded WAC Player of the Week three times in the spring ... competed at No. 1 singles and doubles as a freshman ... posted a 18-6 singles record in the spring season ... reached No. 42 in ITA rankings, the highest on the team ... contributed to the 'Dogs advancement in the ITA team rankings to No. 59 ... played in the NCAA Tournament against No. 20 Notre Dame and earned the first set victory over No. 5 Kristy Frilling but could not finish because the match was clinched ... clinched the match against No. 51 Arizona defeating Lacey Smyth, 1-6, 6-3, 6-4 ... went undefeated in WAC play in singles and doubles ... was victorious over UNLV's No. 68 Lucia Batta, 6-2, 0-6, 6-2... defeated No. 74 Stephanie
